metadata.Title: CVE-2014-8628 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description: Memory leak in PolarSSL before 1.2.12 and 1.3.x before 1.3.9 allows remoteattackers to cause a denial of service (memory consumption) via a largenumber of crafted X.509 certificates.  NOTE: this identifier has been SPLITper ADT3 due to different affected versions. See CVE-2014-9744 for theClientHello message issue.

criterions.comment: polarssl: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
